intro: Osmoxylon luzoniense, commonly known as the Luzon osmoxylon, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related species. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in lowland forests and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
